If the perimeter of a rectangle is 303 cm and the length is 43 cm longer than the width, find the length and width.

Nick and Chloe left their campsite by canoe and paddled downstream at an average speed of 12 km/h. They turned around and paddled back upstream at an average rate of 4 km/h. The total trip took 1 hour. After how much time did the campers turn around downstream?
How much of a 7% acid solution should be mixed with how much of a 15% acid solution so that you obtain 20 gallons of a 12% acid solution?
What are two numbers whose sum is 102 and whose difference is 21?
The perimeter of a rectangle is 28 inches. The length is 8 less than 5 times the width. What is the length of the rectangle?

Tom and Jerry drove 270 total miles in 3 hours. Tom always drives 41 mph and Jerry always drives 59 mph. It's a wonder they can manage to remain friends. How many hours did Tom drive and how many hours did Jerry drive?

Margaret has her total savings of $24198 in two different CD accounts. One CD earns 4.3% interest and another earns 3.7% interest. If her total interest for the year is $1007.13, then how much does she have in each CD account?
A total of $11998 is invested in two funds paying 11% and 13% simple interest. If the yearly interest is $1180, how much of the $11998 is invested at 11% and how much is invested at 13%?
A river cruise ship sailed 61 miles downstream for 5 hours and then took 5 hours sailing upstream to return to the dock. Find the speed of the ship in still water and the speed of the river current.
Find the length and width of a rectangular garden if the perimeter is 155 m and the width is 20 m less than the length.
The length of a rectangle is 7 cm longer than the width. If the length is increased by 8 cm and the width by 6 cm, the perimeter will be 163 cm. Find the dimensions of the ORIGINAL rectangle.
A barn door has a perimeter of 14.8 m. If 5 times the height is equal to 6 times the width, find the dimensions.
The sum of half of a number, x, and another number, y, is -28. The difference of x and y is 7. Find x and y.
The larger of two numbers is 11 more than twice the smaller number. The sum of the numbers is 1 less than nine times the smaller number. Find the numbers.
A rectangular parking lot has perimeter 253 feet. The length is five feet more than twice the width. Find the length and width of the parking lot.
A syrup manufacturer has some pure maple syrup and some which is 85% maple syrup. How many liters of each should be mixed to make 149L which is 98% maple syrup?

A class of 32 consists of students who either have red or yellow shirts. If there are 13 more people with red shirts than there are people with yellow shirts, how many of the students have red shirts?

A stone fell from the top of a cliff into the ocean. In the air, it had an average speed of 18 m/s. In the water, it had an average speed of 6 m/s before hitting the seabed. The total distance from the top of the cliff to the seabed is 125 meters, and the stone's entire fall took 13 seconds. How long did the stone fall in the air and how long did it fall in the water?
The sum of a twice a number, x, and twice another number, y, is -76. The value of x is three less than the value of y. Find x and y.
It takes a boat 2 hours to travel 24 miles downstream and 3 hours to travel 18 miles upstream. What is the speed of the boat in still water and of the current of the river?
Dante has 28 coins that are all dimes and quarters. The value of the coins is $4.26. How many dimes and how many quarters does Dante have?
Dante has 27 coins that are all dimes and quarters. The value of the coins is $4.35. How many dimes and how many quarters does Dante have?

The price, x, of an entertainment system at Extreme Electronics is $220 less than twice the price, y, of the same system at Ultra Electronics. The difference in price between the system at Extreme Electronics and Ultra Electronics is $175. Which system of linear equations can be used to determine the price of the system at each store?
A farmhouse shelters 12 animals, some are pigs, and some are ducks. Altogether there are 37 legs. How many pigs are there?
Two angles of a triangle are the same size. The third angle is 11° smaller than the first angle. Find the measure of the angles.
A hair dye is made by blending 7% hydrogen peroxide solution and a 2% hydrogen peroxide solution. How many mililiters of each are used to make a 298 ml solution that is 6% hydrogen peroxide?
A river cruise ship sailed 60 miles downstream for 4 hours and then took 5 hours sailing upstream to return to the dock. Find the speed of the ship in still water and the speed of the river current.
The sum of Clyde and Wendy’s ages is 64. In four years, Wendy will be three times as old as Clyde. How old are they now?

Ava’s school took a field trip. A total of 34 vehicles were needed for the trip. Some students took the bus, and some students car-pooled. There were 29 people on each bus and 2 people in each car. 410 people altogether attended the trip. How many buses and cars were needed for the trip?

At a restaurant the cost for a breakfast taco and a small glass of milk is $2.43. The cost for 4 tacos and 5 small glasses of milk is $4.93. Which pair of equations can be used to determine x, the cost of a taco, and y, the cost of a small glass of milk?

Jacob puts all of his pennies and nickels in his piggy bank. He has saved up a total of 474 coins. Altogether, there is a total of $11.22 in his bank. How many pennies and how many nickels does he have in his piggy bank?
Girls are 15 more than boys, and boys represent 31% of all students. Find how many girls are in the class.

A grocery store offers a cheese and fruit sampler that combines cheddar cheese that costs $9 per kilogram with kiwis that cost $2 per kilogram. How many kilograms of each were used to make a 7 kg mixture that costs $4.49 per kilogram?
A clothing manufacturer has some pure silk thread and some thread that is 88% silk. How many kilograms of each must be woven together to make 73 kg of cloth that is 94% silk?

Noah's class held a food drive for the holidays. There are a total of 24 students in his class. Each boy brought an average of 5 cans and each girl brought an average of 6 cans for a total of 108 cans. How many girls are in class?
The perimeter of a rectangular field is 96 meters. The length is five meters less than two times the width. Find the length and width (its dimensions).

On a 223 mi trip, a car traveled at an average speed of 50 mph and then reduced its average speed to 38 mph for the remainder of the trip. The trip took a total of 7 h. How long did the car travel at each speed?

Ms. Kitts works at a music store. Last week she sold 4 more than 3 times the number of CDs that she sold this week. Ms. Kitts sold a total of 110 CDs over the 2 weeks. Which system of equations can be used to find x, the number of CDs she sold last week, and y, the number of CDs she sold this week?
Ross Labs needs to make 3198 gallons of 41% acid solution. They have 37% acid solution and 54% solution. How many gallons of each type are needed to make 3198 gallons of the 41% acid solution?

A tea that is 18% jasmine is blended with a tea that is 17% jasmine. How many pounds of each tea are used to make 4 lb of tea that is 18% jasmine?
A 9002-seat amphitheater has tickets for sale at $33 and $65. How many tickets should be sold at each price for a sellout performance to generate a total revenue of $382499?

William bought some tickets to see his favorite singer. He bought some adult tickets and some children’s tickets, for a total of 15 tickets. The adult tickets cost $29 per ticket, and the children’s tickets cost $23 per ticket. If he spent a total of $271, then how many adult and children’s tickets did he buy?
The sum of the digits in a two-digit number is 17. Furthermore, the number itself is 5 greater than 14 times the tens digits. Find the number.
Find the length and width of a rectangular garden if the perimeter is 152 m and the width is 22 m less than the length.
